options.description: A short story about teddy bears.

Timmy let go of his red balloon and it soared high into the sky. He thought he'd lost it forever, but a friendly bird caught it and brought it back. Timmy hugged the bird and thanked it for being so kind.

An acorn dreamed of growing into a tall tree, but it was tiny and scared. One day, it decided to bury itself deep in the soil. Soon, a mighty oak tree sprouted, and the acorn realized bravery made dreams come true.

Every night, the stars twinkled in the sky, but one star dreamed of dancing. It leapt and twirled, making the whole sky sparkle with joy. From that night on, the stars always danced together, filling the night with magic.

Wally the worm wanted to see the world above the ground. He wriggled out of his hole and explored the garden, meeting bugs and flowers along the way. By the end of the day, Wally was proud of his new adventures and wiggled back home.
Why didn't the teddy bear asked for dessert? Because it was already stuffed!
What do you call a bear with no teeth? A gummy bear!
Why did the math book looked so sad? It had many problems!
I used to play piano by ear. Now I use my hands!
The early bird gets the worm, but the second mouse gets the cheese.
A group of flamingos is called a flamboyance, Isn't this flam-stastic?
You can't hum for long while holding your nose, try it!
Sea otters hold hands while sleeping to keep from drifting apart, it is very cute!
Butterflies taste with their feet, but please do not attempt it!
You can hear a blue whale's heartbeat from over 2 miles away. How heartfelt is that?
What can travel the world while staying in the corner? (stamp)
I have cities, but no houses. I have forests, but no trees. I have rivers, but no water. What am I? (map)
I’m tall when I’m young, and I’m short when I’m old. What am I? (candle)
What has keys but can't open locks? (piano)
What comes down but never goes up? (rain)
A short joke about teddy bears.
